q.q: Today I found myself watching YouTube videos all day, afraid to do anything besides that. I do have feelings of discomfort like that- which makes it hard for me to do activities that seem a bit scary to me even though it's all in my head. But today was the first time I had actually stooped so low in a very very long time. I was procrastinating on these two simple tasks I told myself to fulfill. Prior to playing my keyboard, I wanted to inspect my approach to music and perhaps change it. And I wanted to draw something original because I find that so scary. Both tasks were scary to me- playing the keyboard and drawing something original. The reason why playing the keyboard to me is scary is because my mind numbs to it and I find it harder to innovate. This makes me feel bad because it makes me feel like an insecure failiure. Drawing something original scares me because I'm the past I've found it to be quite a stress enduring task because I judge my wor k so har shly, I find it difficult to lift myself off the ground and persue an idea because I want it to be so perfect so bad. So both tasks are pretty stress enducing and my procrastination and fear got the best of me. It makes me feel sad. But... procrastinating felt so good that I'm confused to this whole situation. I came to the conclusion this morning that my approach to art was causing unnecessary stress and if I change my approach, art is bound to be more fun for me. But I pussied out! Because I was back in my stupid house that I hate being in and I found it to be so overwhelming I didn't even dare to try. Dammit I'm fucking retarded. ...why is it so hard for me to do this? it's hard to tell what the core of importance is when trying to shuffle everything around until it reads like something that 'makes sense'. or maybe it's that when i feel the pressure to do this, i didn't get a chance to decide what i mean, it was imposed on me either by some Authority or my own self thinking it's absolutely necessary. then it's a fight to figure out what makes sense, what makes sense to me, what's going to make sense to whoever's going to see it, and that's hard to tease out especially with a real or even imagined deadline. i get caught up in teasing it up all nice, and it might carry some of the right meaning, but it's severely watered down or the real big points are underdeveloped in favor of presentability. and it's not exactly that i'm consciously trying to make it fake. it's endlessly second-guessing what's strong and what's not when i can delete and rephrase as much as i want. the reason rambling beginning-to-end with no edits works is because it's just everything that goes through my head, which is as real and close to my thoughts as anything...becuase... you know, they're my thoughts. how did that not occur to me? i can't believe myself. well. at least i know now.

q.a: if you want to be clear, simplicity is always your friend. another great strategy to try when writing something for an audience if you are trying to make sure it is 'perceived' well: run-thrus. run through/read through the product in real time, after clearing your mind totally. so clear your mind totally (this works best if you do your read-throughs after doing something completely different for a while but not everyone has that kind of time) my trick that i use is i walk over and touch the door handle and return to the desk and do a timed run-through. this is the most clear way of seeing exactly how it is going to play out from the audience's perspective then after the run through you can try to recall vividly exactly which parts got you most excited and which parts didn't. and, what to do next. you will see this most clearly during the run through or in the 5 seconds after. capture your notes very quickly, and try to ascertain all that you felt about the run through. then make the necessary changes, if any, and get ready to do another run-through. sometimes you will take some notes but you are still not sure what to change, then the moment of clarity fades. that's ok. re-set and do another run through

q.q: i have a question. i think you said you are concocting your next song to work without bass,  or that you were recording bass last in order to make sure it is still strong without bass. something to that effect. does that mean bass was central to your other recordings?

q.a: i've presumably snuck by just by the seat of my pants. they're not written for bass, or as bass songs, they're just written as song songs, but a bass player secretly knows that any song is actually the best place for the bass to have a hot ball
q.q: cause i listen to a lot of your songs thru my phone speakers and they still sound good to me,

q.a: it's something i've been too scared to think about. but when i saw all my stuff doing so well on vine, i just sort of blindly and superstitiously accepted the fact that a large percentage of the audience was bassless and i was scared to think about it. for example many of those like "stronger videos" is going crazy on bass, but fortunately it gets by ok, again i'm sure this is largely because nothing was written with the bass in mind. all the bass fun is like 'bass player' fun (not writer) in that it's all after the song has been written, and those bass elements come from the player not the writer. song was already written before if that makes sense. like i said it was scary doing it blind but one day i just decided if this is actually where the music is being heard i need to actually hear it at some point. so i made an EQ setting to match the sound of a tiny bassless speaker and i can click it on any time, i call it the iphone simulator. and i recommend everyone should check this frequently especially at the very very beginning of your arrangement, what the hell even leave it on for long periods of time, especially at the beginning of the process. like making a compelling 3d drawing which has to look good in 3d but half your audience will only see it in 2d so it has to look great in 2d too. you're better off starting in 2d, because if you start in 3d it will be too easy to make it 3d because anything looks 3d automatically, and then when you flip it to 2d it could be garbage. where as if you start in 2d, you'll be forced to figure out how to make it look 3d even on the 2d system. if you do that you'll be way ahead of the game. then flip it to 3d and then add all the extra crazy things in 3d which won't mess up the 2d

q.a: actually sometimes the most true and powerful expressions occur before you have barely learned anything. and at the same time, no amount of experience will ever be enough to express anything 'perfectly' unless you adopt the view that everything is perfect (which is a fine view) in which case that's great news because that means anything you could possibly do would be perfect even if it wasn't quite what you were expecting (kind of like people)
q.q: I think that's how I can truly be happy you know- being confident in the future and in yourself. I'm a bit hesitant to go all in and have a whole bunch of confidence that if I get better at art I'll be all set in life. I mean even if I'm wrong, I might as well try, right? It's better than just sitting here extremely afraid and sad. And i feel like I can learn a lot from it all- I mainly think that being good at art would be what makes me joyous and feel fulfilled in life because I love expressing myself. But if I can express myself in a more moving and beautiful way like through music and drawing, I think I'll have a blast. I can express myself in ways that have never been done before. q.q: i could be. maybe.    oh fuck i'm doing that thing again where i start with a nothing-phrase because i want to send something but don't have a real question in mind, i just want to be heard and acknowledged, and my feelings all leak out in this lazy-crazy-rambly way but i'm just talking to myself and it just keeps going and going until it's beyond unanswerable and maybe it's also lame and embarrassing there's a nifty new word for that that i fucking hate but only because it applies to the vast majority of my actions (((Cringy))) and then when i realize it's reached the point of being an unanswerable wall of manic cognitive behavioral diarrhea i go on for a few dozen more lines in which i acknowledge this and then i have to decide whether to send it in or save it in my notes and spare you the pain and then i remember that the not-punctuating thing had gotten old. this makes me want to stop sending anything in ever, because frankly i'm being fucking ridiculous. but it's hard to get the words out when you know no one is going to see them. but it's also easy. maybe when i do this i'm in a blended state of that. i start off trying to talk to someone real, but when i think about that, i feel like i'm being fake, so i try to let go of the worry of how it seems and say what i really need to, which turns into just talking to myself. that's the only way i have known how to communicate what i really mean. no one has been there to listen. it's hard to communicate with others on a true level when 99% of your communication is to yourself in the dry echo chamber of your personal language. try to pour the steaming hot crazy into a mold of understandable meaning and the mold melts into it. it's hard to remember what makes sense to other people if you don't talk to other people and you forget what makes sense in the context of you having thought about it at every different angle for hundreds of hours, and then you try to explain it based on the conclusions that you made a  long time ago that you forgot were conclusions that are contingent on a lot of thinking that the other person has not done and cannot understand unless you guide them through that. but it was a long, messy process that you keep forgetting and remembering infinitely. but if you try to fit it into what you know about The World Outside Your Mind, you might find that the things you say aren't necessarily what you mean but things that you've heard that sound like they make sense and, stringed together, sound like what a person  could really be thinking, and that person might be able to understand it, but it feels as if you just tried to make it make sense at the expense of it not matching what you're feeling.

q.a: i'm not sure what you mean but i know who this is because you've been sending me a long string of messages for several months now with a deep obsession with my past (which is ok) but from the start you had a deep certainty that you were somehow my soul mate and that i was meant to be with you. you probably sent me at least 500 messages like this before i even responded to any of them. and when i finally told you to please leave me alone, the messages continued but mostly took a more negative turn. many of the messages have been sexual in nature, and most of them make no secret of spending countless hours deeply analyzing everything i have ever done, which is fine, but the nature of the messages is more than several steps over the line into the stalker creepy zone. i wish i could properly explain this for people who have not seen the types of messages you have sent me. obsessing over people is great and fine, i'm not saying obsession is bad, i used to act out mr. roger's opening routine verbatim hundreds of times a day. i don't want anyone to misunderstand what i'm saying here. obsession is fine, but what you have done beyond that is send me a never ending stream of messages presuming that you are destined to be with me in every way including romantically. it would be difficult for anyone reading this to understand the nature of this because they have not seen the messages. but i was uncomfortable after about the 50th message, ever since you started sending me loads of messages every day insisting you are my soul mate, looking forward to having sex with me, that sort of thing. all before you ever got a response from me. sure i believe in soul mates, sure i believe in supernatural stuff, sure i believe in the magic of this universe, but you're stalking me and it's turned into harassment. i don't like it and i never liked it, i've tried to tell you to stop, i don't think you're going to, that's ok, i still don't like it, but i don't think i can count on you stopping, i am wondering if you will stop, but i just need to let you know that you are really being a creep here and you have been for a long time, and i wish you would stop trying to blame me for not being 'open to the world' when really it's simply that i am not open to being .. . .. for lack of a more eloquent term .. ... .... stalked and creeped upon. that's all i have to say and i don't like having to post this publicly and i realize most people reading this have not seen all the messages you've sent me so they couldn't possibly know the extent and sheer magnitude and nature of the messages you have sent me but i just need to express this here because you seem to have no intention of ever stopping
q.q: There's a lot of new doors for you to open and a lot of new rooms for you to explore in this life and I'd hate for you to delay your journey any longer than you already have. (Yeah, it's not always gonna be smooth sailing and perhaps the boat has seen better days, but as far as magic goes, you ain't seen nothin' yet.) Or don't. Cower in the corner playing the same level of solitaire over and over and over. Your choice.

But the way my own creativity is wired, writing lyrics and music at the same time would be like writing ambidextrously in two different languages at once. For a long time, as a songwriter/composer/alien/etc I saw my lyrics as simply a vessel for the vocal melody, and resented the the listeners' inevitable search Deeper Meaning where there wasn't any. q.q: I was in the studio with my band this past weekend to record the instrumentals for a few songs. I'm responsible for the vocals, and have as of now composed about 75% of the vocal melodies. But I have no idea what to do about lyrics. Long story short, I only have 2 weekends, 3 weekends max to write lyrics, finish writing vocal melodies, and record the vocal parts. I've tried in vain to get a jump start on the lyrics but I feel absolutely stuck. I don't want to vomit out nonsense filler words (this will likely be the last thing my band ever records/releases, as I am moving across the ocean next month).
